item.title: Salman Rushdie stabbing suspect charged with attempted murder
item.description: The author will likely lose an eye, and the nerves in his arm were "severed" and his liver was "stabbed and damaged," his agent said.

item.title: What is the Espionage Act?
item.description: The Justice Department is investigating Trump for potential Espionage Act violations, according to a search warrant. What does it mean?

item.title: Earth spinning faster is no reason to panic, scientists say
item.description: News of the faster rotation led to misleading posts on social media about the significance of the measurement, leading some to express concern about its implications.

item.title: 8/13: CBS Saturday Morning
item.description: Federal magistrate unseals Trump’s Mar-a-Lago search warrant, The Dish: Alaska’s remote restaurant, The Potato

item.title: Western wildfires threaten carbon offsets
item.description: As companies and individuals attempt to shrink their carbon footprints by buying carbon offsets, wildfires in the U.S. West are threatening the land set aside for such efforts. Senior national and environmental correspondent Ben Tracy reports.

item.title: 935,000 people told to boil water in Michigan after water main break
item.description: The 120-inch pipe in St. Clair County, called a water main, carries treated water from Lake Huron and is the largest in the system, the agency said.

item.title: Oscar-winning director Ron Howard on new film “Thirteen Lives”
item.description: CBS News national correspondent Michelle Miller speaks with the Oscar-winning director Ron Howard about his upcoming film “Thirteen Lives.” The movie chronicles the 2018 rescue mission of a soccer team that was trapped inside of a cave in Thailand for more than two weeks.

item.title: Saturday Sessions: Fantastic Cat performs “Ain’t This the Strangest Town”
item.description: Four acclaimed singer-songwriters joined forces to create an indie-folk-rock band and have since released their debut album, “The Very Best of Fantastic Cat.” For Saturday Sessions, Fantastic Cat performs “Ain’t This the Strangest Town."

item.title: New York City detects virus that causes polio
item.description: The virus that causes polio – a disease which had not been seen in the U.S. in nearly a decade – has recently been detected in New York City. Elaine Quijano has more.

item.title: Scientists make discovery on dinosaur believed to be related to the Loch Ness Monster
item.description: Some believers claim the Loch Ness Monster was a descendant of the plesiosaur.

item.title: House passes major health, climate and tax bill
item.description: CBS News senior White House and political correspondent Ed O’Keefe discusses the “Inflation Reduction Act,” passed Friday by the House, which will provide billions of dollars for health, climate and trimming the federal deficit. The bill now heads to president Joe Biden to become law.

item.title: The Dish: Alaska’s remote restaurant, The Potato
item.description: Surrounded by America’s largest national park, the Potato is a remote restaurant in McCarthy, Alaska that requires the ultimate travel commitment. CBS News correspondent Jeff Glor checks it out.

item.title: Eye Opener: Donald Trump investigated for potential obstruction of justice
item.description: An unsealed search warrant for former president Donald Trump’s Mar-a-Lago estate revealed he is under investigation for potential obstruction of justice under the Espionage Act. Also, President Joe Biden plans to sign the “Inflation Reduction Act.” All that and all that matters in today’s Eye Opener.

item.title: Russian forces appear to intensify attacks in Ukraine
item.description: After explosions rocked a Russian airbase in Crimea earlier this week, Russian forces appear to have intensified attacks in Ukraine. CBS News senior foreign correspondent Charlie D’Agata reports.

item.title: Officials warn of threats targeting FBI agents following Trump's Mar-a-Lago search
item.description: There are renewed warnings for threats targeting federal agents following the search of former president Donald Trump’s Mar-a-Lago estate. It comes after an Ohio man, who was an apparent Trump supporter, was killed in an hours-long standoff when he allegedly attempted to breach security at an FBI office. Jeff Pegues reports.

item.title: Deputy who took grisly Kobe Bryant crash photos: "I didn't do anything wrong"
item.description: Deputy Doug Johnson as among the first to arrive at the scene of the crash that killed Kobe Bryant, his teen daughter and seven others.

item.title: Hoppy Kercheval on being a “vessel” between Sen. Joe Manchin and West Virginia
item.description: CBS News congressional correspondent Scott MacFarlane speaks with West Virginia radio host Hoppy Kercheval on his role, which he describes as a “vessel” between Sen. Joe Manchin and the community.

item.title: Discovery fuels Loch Ness Monster believers
item.description: A recent discovery by paleontologists working in Morocco’s Sahara Desert has fueled believers of the Loch Ness Monster. Dana Jacobson has more.

item.title: Saturday Sessions: Fantastic Cat performs "C'mon Armageddon"
item.description: Four acclaimed singer-songwriters joined forces to create an indie-folk-rock band and have since released their debut album, “The Very Best of Fantastic Cat.” For Saturday Sessions, Fantastic Cat performs "C'mon Armageddon."

item.title: Saturday Sessions: Fantastic Cat performs "Fiona"
item.description: Four acclaimed singer-songwriters joined forces to create an indie-folk-rock band and have since released their debut album, “The Very Best of Fantastic Cat.” For Saturday Sessions, Fantastic Cat performs “Fiona.”

item.title: Federal magistrate unseals Trump’s Mar-a-Lago search warrant
item.description: A federal magistrate unsealed the search warrant used at former president Donald Trump’s Mar-a-Lago estate. The warrant shows that FBI agents were told to look for signs that official records had been altered, destroyed or concealed. Debra Alfarone has more.

item.title: 2 dead, casino damaged by monsoon flooding in Las Vegas
item.description: Social media posts showed water leaking from the ceiling onto gambling tables at the Planet Hollywood resort.

item.title: Did I get the polio vaccine? How to know if you're protected against the virus
item.description: A case of polio was identified in Rockland County, New York, and now the virus has been detected in New York City's wastewater.

item.title: This week on "Sunday Morning" (August 14)
item.description: A look at the features for this week's broadcast of the #1 Sunday morning news program

item.title: Author Salman Rushdie attacked and stabbed on stage
item.description: Author Salman Rushdie, whose writing is considered by some to be blasphemous, was attacked and stabbed on stage just as he was about to speak in New York. Nikki Battiste has more.

item.title: Snake researcher dies from rattlesnake bite in West Virginia
item.description: Martin was perhaps the foremost authority on timber rattlers, according to another rattlesnake researcher.

item.title: Family of slain Fort Hood soldier seeking $35 million in damages
item.description: In April 2021, the U.S. Army released a report saying officers at Fort Hood ignored Guillén's complaints of sexual harassment.

item.title: Salman Rushdie severely injured in stabbing at lecture in New York; suspect in custody
item.description: The 75-year-old author was stabbed in the neck and in the abdomen, officials said during a Friday evening press conference.

item.title: Polio detected in NYC's sewage, suggesting virus circulating
item.description: Last month, the New York Health Department reported the nation's first case of polio in almost a decade, in Rockland County, north of New York City.

item.title: Mar-a-Lago search warrant released, reveals FBI seized top-secret classified documents
item.description: The Justice Department is investigating the former president for potential Espionage Act violations.
